Dear Benson Boone. I know you won‚Äôt ever see this but whenever I hear this song, it hits me so hard because I lost my dad when I was 8 to suicide, he hung himself. This song is so emotional and I relate so much to it. It‚Äôs been so many Christmases without him. I miss my dad so so much. Thank you lots to anyone who took the time to read this.  edit: I hope you saw this benson Ô∏è Ô∏è edit #2: my dad‚Äôs brother just passed away yesterday too (june 20th 2025)

I used to listen to this song and cry for no reason at all. But now, I have a real reason to cry. It‚Äôs been 46 days since I lost my dad , and every lyric hits harder than ever. There's something about this song that just awakens a part of me that so rarely ever comes out. I can't make it all the way through it without crying by the final chorus and I'm not ashamed by it at all. So far, I've yet to lose anyone quite like the lost loved one described here, but I have lost many that I've cared about, and this song really has a way of letting the grief I could never truly feel in those moments out. What a beautiful melody. It now stands as the soundtrack to my work in-progress novel from the very day it began. I look forward to returning here again whenever I need to let that grief out. To my family in the stars, you are missed, you are loved, you are remembered.
